Certificate in Ayurveda Infertility Management (CAIM) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: CAIM is an advanced modular program aimed at Ayurveda practitioners and nursing staff targeting the rising incidence of reproductive disorders through traditional protocols.

  • Objectives: To manage PCOS, oligospermia, and secondary infertility non-invasively through diet, herbs, and Uttarbasti.
  • Duration: 6 Months
  • Eligibility: BAMS, BHMS, or equivalent AYUSH degrees / Nursing with Ayurveda background.

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

Module-wise Structure:

  • Module 1 (Masa 1-2): Stri Roga & Prasuti Tantra (Ayurvedic Gynaecology), Understanding Artava (Menstrual cycles) and Shukra Dhatu.
  • Module 2 (Masa 3-4): Pathogenesis of Vandhyatva (Infertility), Pharmacological interventions (Phala Ghrita, Shatavari, Ashwagandha).
  • Module 3 (Masa 5-6): Clinical formulations, Uttarbasti training, Male infertility protocols, Final Assessment.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Subject-Wise Detailed Syllabus

Unit: Male Infertility Protocols (Module 3)

  • Topic Breakdown: Klaibya (Impotence/Erectile Dysfunction), Shukradusti (Semen anomalies), Vajikarana therapy formulation.
  • Learning Objectives: Ability to prescribe authentic Rasayana to improve sperm morphology and motility.

4Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Clinical/Workshop Components: 15-day hands-on workshop on Uttarbasti (intra-uterine herbal enema) sterilization and administration under a senior Vaidya.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Entrepreneurship: Establishment of specialized Ayurveda fertility clinics. High success rate in non-surgical PCOS reversal creates strong word-of-mouth premium clientele.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ30,000 - ‚Çπ50,000/month (as consulting specialist in Ayurveda chains).

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Case Study Practice: Managing anovulatory cycles in a 32-year-old female using purely herbal pathways.

Certificate in Ayurveda Nutrition & Dietetics (CAND) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: CAND merges modern clinical nutrition with the ancient science of Ahara (Diet) logic based on Prakriti (Body Constitution) and Dosha dominance.

  • Objectives: To prescribe therapeutic diets for lifestyle disorders like Diabetes, Obesity, and Hypertension based on Ahara Vidhi Vishesha Ayatanani (Dietetic rules).
  • Duration: 6 Months

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Module 1: Ayurvedic Principles of Ahara, Concept of Agni & Ama, Prakriti assessment.
  • Module 2: Modern clinical nutrition mapping (Macronutrients vs Panchamahabhutas), Pathya-Apathya (Do's and Don'ts) for specific systemic diseases.
  • Module 3: Menu planning, Ayurvedic cooking workshop, Anthropometric assessment practicum.

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hands-on: Calculating BMI, BMR, mapping dietary plans matching individual Doshas, preparing medicinal gruels (Peya, Vilepi, Yavagu).

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Private Sector: Ayurveda Dietician in yoga ashrams, luxury wellness retreats.
  • Entrepreneurship: Online Diet & Lifestyle consultancy (highly scalable).
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ20,000 - ‚Çπ35,000/month.

Certificate in Ayurveda Parasurgery (CAP) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: Focuses on Kshara Sutra, Agnikarma, and Raktamokshana (Leech Therapy) - the highly effective parasurgical procedures of Shalya Tantra used for anorectal disorders and chronic pain.

  • Duration: 6 Months
  • Eligibility: Strictly limited to recognized AYUSH practitioners and advanced OT staff (varies by state laws).

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Module 1: Anatomy of Anal Canal, Pathogenesis of Arsha (Piles), Bhagandara (Fistula), Parikartika (Fissure).
  • Module 2: Preparation of Kshara (alkaline ashes) and Kshara Sutra (medicated thread).
  • Module 3: Viddhakarma (Acupuncture-like therapy), Agnikarma (thermal micro-cautery), Jalaukaavacharana (Medical leeches).

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hands-on: Assisting in 20 Kshara Sutra ligations, maintaining leech aquariums and observing 10 Jalauka application sessions for varicose veins.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Roles: Specialized Anorectal clinics are among the most profitable segments in Ayurveda. Kshara Sutra yields recurrence rates under 2% compared to modern allopathic fistulectomies.

üéì STUDENT ENGAGEMENT CONTENT

  • Workshop: Standardization of Kshara thread pH levels.

Certificate in Ayurvedic Cosmetology, Skin & Beauty Care (CACSBC) - Master Curriculum

1Ô∏è‚É£ Course Overview

Course Introduction: Merges holistic internal Ayurveda blood purification therapies with external herbal cosmetics applications.

  • Duration: 6 Months

2Ô∏è‚É£ Academic Structure

  • Module 1: Anatomy of Twak (Skin) & Kesha (Hair), Understanding Vata-Pitta-Kapha skin types.
  • Module 2: Formulation of Lepa (Face packs), Taila (Oils), Mukha Abhyanga (Facial Massage).
  • Module 3: Treating Mukhadushika (Acne), Darunaka (Dandruff), Khalitya (Hair loss) via Shodhana (detox) and Shamana (pacification).

3Ô∏è‚É£ Practical / Clinical Component

  • Hands-on: Preparation of Kumkumadi Taila, conducting herbal steam therapy (Swedana), formulating custom organic scrubs based on client Prakriti.

üöÄ CAREER & FUTURE GROWTH

  • Private Sector: Lead Aesthetician at premium Ayurvedic Spas (Biotique, Forest Essentials).
  • Entrepreneurship: Launching a boutique line of organic, authentic Ayurvedic skincare formulations.
  • Salary Range: ‚Çπ25,000 - ‚Çπ40,000/month (base + incentives).
